content: Hey @Aman Arora -- how are things? I just wanted to check-in and see how things were going, what you were working on, and if you felt stuck on anything.

We should I guess decide how to synchronize on progress -- we could make a kind of regular meeting if that would be helpful, but at least having a shared document with the plans and steps would be good. Since I'm juggling a few things I tend to get a bit confused if I don't have a doc to jump back to to remember what was going on.

Hi, last week has been fairly busy for us and we weren't able to get muc done. Plan is to spend rest of the week investigate the suggestions for HIR Places refactor.

We have project board here: https://github.com/sexxi-goose/rust/projects/1

If you would prefer a shared doc, I can get something started.
I'd suggest a doodle for planning the meeting and we can discuss how often we want to do sync
a project board seems reasonable
If you get a chance can you go over it and see if there is some more concrete ways we can split tasks? It's currently based of the plan you had written here: https://hackmd.io/HNEgTkPlTuy6cb9v29rzIQ
OK, I'm jumping back to this topic
I think we should have meeting and discuss some of the refactor work. Can you send out a doodle like last time?
I agree, it seems like we need to sync back up
I'm also a bit unclear on what has happened thus far
Mostly the renaming for upvars -> upvars_mentioned, upvars_list -> closure_captures. There is a PR in the works to use closure_captures instead of upvars_mentioned once typechk is done
OK.
I'm looking at the project board
I see a lot of stuff on there :)
Yeah, I tried to separate out everything that was in your plan, into concrete tasks, so that it's easier to add notes and keep track in general. Please let us know if we can split things better.
Yeah, I am thinking it'd be useful to have a kind of canonical dependency graph so to speak.
I don't think github projects supports dependencies, however I added that information in some of the tasks
yeah they don't
that's ok
what's your perception, @Aman Arora -- do you all feel like you're moving at "full speed" right now, or do you feel like you're kind of blocked on more feedback?
I think I will try to update the rust-lang/rust tracking issue https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/53488 to track the plan and progress
@Aman Arora can you send me links to the relevant PRs?

We are still waiting on feedback for HirPlaces, because everything seems like depends on what would look like.

Here are the rename PRs:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72544
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72591
Ok, I'm sort of refreshing my memory now
I'll try to write up some details about hir places and so forth
I'm trying to decide how I feel about using the rust fork to track this work
how would you all feel about creating a wg-rfc-2229 repo in rust-lang?
(I'd give you all write access to it)
I'd sort of rather consolidate planning and so forth into somewhere "official"
though I also don't mind if you just want to keep the existing repo and I can write notes and things in hackmds or issues on rust-lang/rust
and that repo can just be for your internal communication
Either works, whatever you think will be easier to keep track on in the future, in case someone wants to look back and see things were done a certain way
yeah it's the historical record that makes me want to move it to a rust-lang repo

nikomatsakis said:

what's your perception, Aman Arora -- do you all feel like you're moving at "full speed" right now, or do you feel like you're kind of blocked on more feedback?

btw the reason I asked this is that
I think that a regular meeting to kind of "get updates" might help if you feel like you are spending time spinning your collective wheels
I agree regular meetings will help us move faster. I was planning on pinging you for it -- I am waiting on someone to get a clear idea about my week's schedule
OK @Aman Arora here is a doodle poll https://doodle.com/poll/ur7q994kce9y5675 for a 30-minute meeting
I'm still waiting on someone to get idea about my Wed/Thursday. I've added my availability for tomorrow.
might honestly be best to start next week anyway
though I will put in some more effort to writing up mentoring instructions today
Thank you :)
Everyone on our end who is going to be joining the meeting has responded on the poll (atleast for tomorrow). If that doesn't work we can schedule it for next week
@Aman Arora I created https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229, and I believe that all of you should have invitations now to the rust org
added to compiler team calendar -- I can add folks as invites if desired, just ping me w/ e-mail
I can just send the link to them and I think that works

Actually that event is missing details for zoom/meet
out emails: chrispardy36@gmail.com, roxane.fruytier@hotmail.com and aman23arora@gmail.com
dhruvjhr@gmail.com
I was figuring we could discuss on Zulip, actually, but Zoom is also ok
maybe Zoom is better for this meeting at least
Also, I'm starting to create issues with details on the project-rfc-2229 repo, such as rust-lang/project-rfc-2229#1
Awesome, thank you. I'll try go through them before the meeting.
Hey @Matthew Jasper not sure if you saw but we're in a Zoom room for today

This is what I'm thinking how we split the work a head:

  • Split Place into PlaceWithId/PlaceUnique and Place (maintain projections as is)

(Reason I didn't want to use PlaceReference is because mir::PlaceRef exists, it's derived from a mir::Place and has a slice instead of a List for projections)

Once that is done we can do the following in parallel

  • Use Place in ClosureCaptures, the HIR id that is in upvars_mentioned can be accessed fromPlaceBase::Upvar(UpvarId::var_path::hir_id)
  • Represent Projection as {Ty, ProjectionKind}

Once these are done we work on categorizing the projections more precisely again in parallel amongst oursleves.

Do you think this sounds reasonable? If so I'll add taks that track individul issues for these in https://github.com/orgs/rust-lang/teams/wg-rfc-2229 (Project grp in the team will probably allow us to track issues/PRs accross different repos -- assuming clippy will need updating once we update Place).

Also when you get a chance can you update https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/blob/master/meetings.md with details from Tuesday?
@Aman Arora that sounds like a good plan. I will update with links indeed
my only hesitation is
whether we actually need to do that first split, I guess
I presume you meant that will add individual issues into the repo (not the github team)?
re: clippy, I believe you can actually update that within the rust-lang repo itself
(because of the new git subtree scheme we've been using)

@nikomatsakis
We would have to refactor some of the code again if we use Place in closure_captures before it's split into two structures.

Mostly because the PlaceBase will now come from PlaceWithHirId.place.place_base

and we need to use PlaceWithId so that we can get span for live nodes in rustc_passes

Also I will create issue in the wg rfc repo, and my comment on clippy was purely related to the project based.

Project board for the team can track issues across multiple repos if I'm not wrong.
yes the project board should be able to track anything in the org
but my point is that you don't probably need seprate PRs to clippy
I think one PR to the rust-lang/rust repo should be able to refactor clippy at the same time
Oh I see, that makes sense
BTW @Aman Arora there were some other issues that were opened in rustc that I think never made much progress, around changing the "upvar tuple" in a closure
I might move those over the project repo
I think that work can be done in parallel with this other work
Yeah, I think so
I think a very basic split of place, should be first and then everything can be split into parallel parts
OK, so, the independent refactoring I was referring to is #57482, and is described starting here
@Aman Arora are you using a project board to track work? I could move that issue over from rust-lang/rust to rust-lang/project-rfc-2229
done https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/issues/4
Not sure if there is anything else you need to help parallelize effort here -- i.e., does everyone who has time have something they are able to do? :)
Another thing i'd like to say is
if it would be helpful, we could schedule time to do a bit of pair coding
That's what we have been doing, we use vscode liveshare
I think there is enough to keep all of us busy for a bit, I'll go through the issue you have linked.
I have been a little busy today, but I'll try get the project board setup by EOD.
I can't seem to create a project within the team, can you create one and I'll add the details
ok
do you want the Basic kanban template?
I think that works, as far as I know you can update automation
https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/projects/1?add_cards_query=is%3Aopen
I made it automated kanban
though I don't quite get why you were not able to make it yourself
as far as I can tell, we both have the same Write permission
Ooooh, I was trying to create the project through the team and not with the repo
heh ok

@nikomatsakis I have updated the project table, included as much detail that I know. It's correct best to my knowledge/understanding but can you please go over then to ensure that I details right especially for use hir::Places in closure_captures
I think it seems right
thanks

Last week was really busy for us and we didn't end up making too much progress. I think it might be better to cancel this week's sync. Sorry for not notifying earlier.

From what I know, we'll begin the place refactor #3 today/tomorrow and we have some progress on using typechk tables for captures #6 here: https://github.com/sexxi-goose/rust/tree/change_upvars_to_typeck_tables_of

Work on categorizing upvar access #12 will probably begin later this week.
OK

@nikomatsakis Just an update on our progress:

  • #3 got merged, thank you for reviewing so quickly.

  • We closed #12 as it was a non-issue.

  • Dhruv and Chris looked at #2 a bit last week and will discuss more and hopefully begin work tomorrow evening.

  • Archer and Roxane have started on #5 today and plumbing the type information around. From what I know they are having some python errors and fighting their local build env.

  • Jenny, Logan and I will probably make some progress on #7 tonight but from the looks of it, we will most likely be constructing the ClosureCaptures map from information passed to InferBorrowKind after we walk the body using ExprUseVisitor instead of before walking body. (As far as I can see closure_captures isn't used within typeck until at the very end in writeback so should'be fine)
OK, do we plan to meet tomorrow?
I believe that indeed you cannot construct the closure captures map until we've finished walking the body, since I think you have to accumulate all the information
Yes currently we were just relying on upvars_mentioned, but we don't generate any Places until we start walking
There isn't really much I think we have on end, I have one question that i asked on the upvar-access-span thread

@nikomatsakis not sure if you got booked over this meeting. But couple things came up late last night. If you have time, it would be great if we can discuss them, if not we can do this next week. whichever works for you.
@Aman Arora I'm available sorry
still around?
Yeah
want to chat on zoom? or zulip
Either works
Let's do Zulip if that works for you
Okay
I think that topic went a little out of the scope, so pulling it here

We have a deliverable heavy monday/tuesday and might need to move the sync meeting a day or week later, just so that those who are attending have better context. I'll check in with them and try let you know by Monday
ok I would actually prefer that
this particular Tuesday is my daughter's birthday so...
I'm pretty available on Wednesday

That's fair, we can discuss details Monday/Tuesday. I'll need to check in with who will be attending the meeting about that time that works for all.

Happy birthday to her in advance :)
@nikomatsakis can you send a doodle to schedule a meeting this week? Wednesday looks like should be good for most of us, but would be good to include Thursday and Friday as well. Thank you
@Aman Arora doodle link
thank you
I think everyone has responded for Tomorrow, Jul 1 2:00 PM-2:30 PM
OK, I think we can do that slot. It's not the most convenient for me but I think it should work ok.
I'll make a calendar event!
Thank you for making the time
@Aman Arora I'm in the room, the link is in the calendar invite
er hmm
maybe I'm in the wong one ;)
I'm merging both the projection and closure-capture doc
recording from today's meeting available
Thank you

@nikomatsakis Archer had pushed a commit for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/73870 to resolve CI errors (missing changes in clippy).

I think you have to approve the new commit. https://buildbot2.rust-lang.org/homu/queue/rust shows that the PR is not approved
@Aman Arora r+'d
Thanks
@nikomatsakis @Matthew Jasper https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74140 can you take another look?
@Aman Arora I was on vacation last week, sorry, back now, but it's merged! :tada:

Thanks.

Do yoiu have any tips for how we can go about debugging the MIR Build issue I describe here: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/122651-general/topic/Debugging.20broken.20MIR/near/204178630

@nikomatsakis there is a meeting scheduled for September 1st, will you be available for it? If not that's fine, the team isn't still back yet.

Things that I have in mind to discuss over the next little bit:

  • [ ] Alternate time, preferrably before 12PM EST
    - else, Dhruv/ Archer might attend these instead (might still require time changes, but would be more flexible)
  • [ ] Discuss closure output: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/189812-t-compiler.2Fwg-rfc-2229/topic/Closure.20pretty.20print.20project-rfc-2229.2315

  • [ ] Discuss language changes: https://github.com/rust-lang/project-rfc-2229/pull/16

  • [ ] Diagnostics for https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/189812-t-compiler.2Fwg-rfc-2229/topic/minimal.20capture.20.239.3A.20interesting.20example
    - Current behavior: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a76d8cc2179e04f2698944185da4d49e
    - For c2 we will say p.y borrowed immutably
    - For c1 if we point at p.x += 10 and say p was borrowed mutably, this feels incorrect from a post RFC-2229 perspective only p.x should be captured by that line.
    - For c1 if we point at p.x += 10 and say p.x was borrowed mutably, it makes me feel that those are disjoint and per RFC-2229, this should work.
    - My thoughts are around: pointing at p.x and p in c1, and say something around the lines that to make this work p was borrowed mutably, which is then later used immutably by p.y.
@Aman Arora I think I would be available, yes, but if people aren't here we could try to discuss async instead

That works too. We also might need to reschedule our weekly syncs, I'm starting an internship on the 14th Sept, so I will be available only before 12PM EST on weekdays. Dhruv and Archer will have a better idea about their schedule once school starts on 7th Sept, but they might just attend the meetings going forward
it'd be ok to reschedule
Sweet :)
just to confirm, you all still plan to stay engaged on the project? I'm not sure at what point you run out of time
We'll still be engaged, yes. It will just be difficult for most us to attend the Rust meetings during work hours (approx 9am-5pm/12-8 pm EST)
